name: Beef Mushroom Barley Soup
author: Wendellian
summary: Family favorite. It kind of turns into a type of stew as the barley soaks up much of the beef stock. Best part is that it gets better with age, so make plenty and enjoy throughout the week! It's always better the second day, so you might want to cook it one day, refrigerate it overnight, and then cook it again the next day.
ingredients: 2 pounds beef stew meat, cut into small pieces
directions: Cook beef stew meat in a large skillet over medium heat until completely browned, 5 to 7 minutes; transfer to a large soup pot
Heat vegetable oil in the same skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion, celery, and carrot in the hot oil until the onions are tender, about 5 minutes
Add the vegetable mixture to the beef in the pot
Pour beef stock into the pot
Stir pearl barley into the stock
Place soup over medium-low heat, bring to a simmer, and cook, stirring occasionally, until the beef is completely tender, about 2 hours
Stir mushrooms through the soup; cook 1 hour more
